column1: Leucine aminopeptidase is a type of protein called an enzyme.
It is normally found in liver cells and cells of the small intestine.

Increased levels of leucine aminopeptidase can be seen in several conditions: - Cholestasis - Cirrhosis - Hepatitis - Liver cancer - Liver ischemia (reduced blood flow to the liver) - Liver necrosis (death of live tissue) - Liver tumor - Pregnancy (late stage)
